content.description: Small route near the parking lot.
content.location: Directly south of the Turtle Rocks parking lot.  Look for the starting hold, it's a pocket that holds water after a rain.

content.description:
This is a great problem, essentially it is a low traverse of the

Angel Fire

face. Start as for

Goonies

on obvious jugs, but instead of traversing high or heading straight up, move through the low thin crimp rail to a toss to the crack. Continue traversing right and end on the easy flake topout on the right side of the boulder.
content.location:
Start about 6-7 feet left of

Angel Fire

and end on the far right side of the face.

content.description: Vertical face climbing using edges and ending on a jug.
content.location: On the back-side of Wall Street.  South of harder bouldering problems.

content.description: Start with both hands on a flake-like jug.  Move up to the horizontal crack, and finish up and to the left.
content.location: This is on a north-facing wall about 150 yards southeast of the main area.

content.description: Phallic bouldering problem on a crystal-filled arete.
content.protection: A spotter is a must and a crash pad is a good idea.
content.location: North East from the main bouldering area.  Easily found from the walk off of the other problems in the area.

content.description: Incredible sequential problem to a sketchy top out.  Excellent layback moves on thin edges, all overhanging.  Possibly the most fun problem in the valley.
content.protection: 2 crash pads.  Landing can be dangerous.
content.location: Middle of the bouldering area.  Top of the crux looks like a heart with a crack in it.

content.description: 2nd problem in the area.  Sit start with a throw to a good jug on the right, followed by another throw to a very thin crimp rail.  Short but good problem.
Sit start to thin edges.  Watch out for the thorny bush at the top.
content.location: Furthest left route before the tree on the Backside of Wall Street.

content.description: Face climbing on a tall pillar
content.location: Backside of Wall Street.  To the furthest right of the pillars, to the left of Options Trader.

content.description: Sit start on two slopers just above a crack. Move your left hand to gaston and your right to a jug. Move up and left. The crux is topping out the ledge. The topout is tall on good rock moving left on a ramp.
content.location:
Walk downhill from

Angel Fire

. It is the last established problem on the left side of the wall.

content.description: This is a fun yet deceptively challenging line up an obvious, blunt arete. Stand start with your hands on a couple of small hold then move up and right. The top out is relatively high, but all the hard climbing is in the first ~12 feet, so it feels very safe. A pleasing combination of technical footwork and strength are required. It is definitely worth doing!
content.location:
This is to the left of

Instant Karma

. See the photos. The approximate coordinates are: 38.881203,-106.147537.

content.description:
Start on

Angel Fire's

jugs, then go out right, and finish the topout with a high right heel.

Start on

Angel Fire's

jugs, then go out left, and finish with the topout.

This starts on a 2 handed jug, which is followed by very small crimps. The route is a direct topout - it doesn't traverse to either side. Make sure not to use anything left of the crack, or it's downgraded to V1.
content.location: It is the 1st problem when entering the area. Everything from the crack to the left is off.
